name: ChangeSignalState
description:
Change the triage state of a security signal.

This tool is used to modify the triage state of a specific security signal in Datadog's security monitoring system. It is useful for managing signal priorities and responses.

parameters.name: signal_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the security signal to be updated.

parameters.name: new_triage_state
parameters.description: The new triage state of the signal. Valid options are 'open', 'archived', or 'under_review'.

value_schema.description: The new triage state of the signal.

parameters.name: archive_comment
parameters.description: Optional comment to display on archived signals. Useful for context or documentation.

value_schema.description: Optional comment to display on archived signals.

parameters.name: archive_reason
parameters.description: Reason for archiving the signal. Options include 'none', 'false_positive', 'testing_or_maintenance', 'investigated_case_opened', or 'other'.

parameters.name: updated_signal_version
parameters.description: The version number of the signal to update. The update is rejected if the server's version is higher.

value_schema.description: Version of the updated signal. If server side version is higher, update will be rejected.

parameters.name: security_signal_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the security signal to be modified.

value_schema.description: The unique ID of the security signal.

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: The type of event, must be 'signal_metadata'.
